title: Galileo's Telescope
description: Galileo Galilei improves the telescope and observes the Moon, Jupiter's moons, and phases of Venus, shifting the paradigm of celestial understanding.

title: From the Earth to the Moon
description: Jules Verne publishes the science fiction novel 'From the Earth to the Moon', inspiring generations of scientists and space dreamers.

title: First Liquid-Fueled Rocket
description: Robert Goddard successfully launches the world's first liquid-fueled rocket, paving the way for modern rocketry.

title: Sputnik 1 Launch
description: The Soviet Union launches the first artificial satellite, Sputnik 1, initiating the space age and triggering the space race.

title: First Human in Space
description: Yuri Gagarin becomes the first human to travel into space aboard Vostok 1, completing one orbit of Earth in 108 minutes.

title: Moon Landing
description: Apollo 11 lands the first humans on the Moon. Neil Armstrong and Buzz Aldrin walk the lunar surface while Michael Collins orbits above.

title: First Space Station
description: The Soviet Union launches Salyut 1, the first space station, ushering in the era of long-term human habitation in orbit.

title: First Space Shuttle Flight
description: NASA's Columbia becomes the first reusable spacecraft to launch into orbit, revolutionizing access to space.

title: Hubble Space Telescope
description: Hubble is launched and begins sending detailed images of deep space, transforming astronomy with never-before-seen clarity.

title: International Space Station
description: Construction of the ISS begins, marking an unprecedented international collaboration in space science and engineering.

title: Curiosity Rover on Mars
description: NASA's Curiosity rover lands on Mars to explore the planet's geology and climate, searching for signs of past life.

title: James Webb Telescope Launch
description: The JWST is launched, offering a powerful new eye on the cosmos with infrared capabilities that reach far back into the early universe.
